What should be included in the individual seminar prep due for week 2?

A macro-environmental analysis includes examining economic factors like exchange rates and global growth, technological innovations, political and legal regulations, and socio-cultural changes. Identify 5-10 key drivers for your assigned factor in your industry, with supporting evidence from reliable sources like Stats Canada, and document these in the provided template.

Where do I submit the individual seminar prep for week 3?
It should be submitted to the drop-box on CourseLink.
What should be included in the individual seminar prep due for week 3?

The industry analysis involves identifying your industry with a specific definition, determining its size by total sales and growth rate, and applying Porter’s Five Forces: threat of entry, threat of substitutes, power of buyers, power of suppliers, and competitive rivalry. Each team member will identify key suppliers, buyers, and substitutes for your industry, then document this information in the provided template.
When is the individual seminar prep due for week 4?

Where do I submit the individual seminar prep for week 4?

What should be included in the individual seminar prep due for week 4?

To conduct a competitive analysis, identify your company's and competitors' geographic locations and financial scales (revenue, sales, market cap). List brands, products, and services, and define the target audience. Evaluate product uniqueness and replicability. Outline advertising strategies and key success factors like innovation. Highlight unique resources. Assess public sentiment with media coverage and customer reviews. This helps identify direct competitors and calculate market share by dividing individual sales by total industry sales. Make sure you use the template provided.

Obtain the company’s annual report and relevant news stories. Describe the organizational structure (functional, divisional, etc.), write a 200-word company description, and state the company’s vision, mission, and core values. Identify if the company states its organizational culture, find news stories about the company’s culture, and compare them with the annual report. Finally, list the top financial or market-based objectives. This will provide a comprehensive understanding of your company’s strategic direction.

For the Week 8 seminar, students need to define fixed, variable, and total costs, provide an equation and examples, calculate average costs, list production costs for a final product, group these costs into variable and fixed categories, determine if the product has more fixed or variable costs, and learn how to create a scatter plot from an Excel table.
When is the individual seminar prep due for week 9?
The individual seminar prep is due in advance of week 9 seminar.
Where do I submit the individual seminar prep for week 9?
It should be submitted to the drop-box on CourseLink.
What should be included in the individual seminar prep due for week 9?

Locate your company's Balance Sheet and input it into the first worksheet of a workbook labelled “Balance Sheet.” Find the Income Statement, input it into the second worksheet labelled “Income Statement,” and separate variable costs from fixed costs. Leave the third worksheet blank. Review section 9.4 on financial statement analysis and lecture slides, and try to find variables for ratio analysis from your spreadsheet.
When is the individual seminar prep due for week 10?
The individual seminar prep is due in advance of week 10 seminar.
Where do I submit the individual seminar prep for week 10?
It should be submitted to the drop-box on CourseLink.
What should be included in the individual seminar prep due for week 10?

For Week 10, review your internal situation analysis (components 3 & 4) to identify key strengths and weaknesses of your organization and review your external situation analysis (components 1 & 2) to identify key opportunities and threats. Ensure that these insights come from your group's assessment to avoid plagiarism. Fill out a SWOT analysis table with these items.
When is the individual seminar prep due for week 11?
There is no individual seminar prep due this week.
Where do I submit the individual seminar prep for week 11?
There is no individual seminar prep for week 11.
When is the individual seminar prep due for week 12?
There are no seminars for week 12.
Where do I submit the individual seminar prep for week 12?
There is no individual seminar prep for week 12.
What is the professor's email?
The professor's email is Krodenbu@uoguelph.ca.
Where is the professor's office?
Dr Kathleen Rodenburg's office is located in MAC 232 and can also be met remotely on Microsoft Teams by appointment.
What format should the referencing be done in?
APA format.
What happens if a component is submitted late?
A 5% penalty per day will apply for late submissions. No report will be accepted after 3 days past the due date.
What should we do if a team member is not contributing?
Report the issue in the confidential PEAR assessments and discuss it with your seminar instructor if necessary.
Where can I find detailed submission instructions for each component?
Management 1000 > Content > Company Project.
When will we receive the ethical dilemma case?
You will receive the ethical dilemma case on November 28th.
What format should the final report be in?
The final report should be in PDF format.
What is the policy for using AI tools for this assignment?
Using AI to generate final projects or component work is considered academic misconduct. You must sign an attestation stating you did not use AI for the assignment.
What should we do if we need an extension on a deadline?
Contact your seminar instructor as soon as possible to discuss the possibility of an extension.
If my lectures are virtual does that mean my seminars are also virtual?
No, all seminars will be in person regardless if a student has virtual lectures.
Are all seminars in person?
Yes, all seminars are in person regardless if a student has virtual lectures.
What does a double weighted course mean?
This course is a double weighted course, meaning it is like taking two courses which is worth 1.00 credit instead of 0.50.
What is tea time?

With over 900 students in Management 1000 and only one instructor, it's often hard for first-year students to engage with faculty. To help, the prof hosts a weekly Tea-Time for 45 students, joined by various faculty and Dean’s office members. This is a great chance to meet future professors, ask questions about courses or programs, or simply socialize. Sign up is first-come, first-served on CourseLink (CourseLink > connect > groups). Each student can attend one Tea-Time, with about 400 spots available this semester. Past participants have loved this event.
What is in-class participation polling?
In-class participation polling is an interactive way students must engage in live lectures to earn participation marks, adding up to 10 total points throughout the course.
Can I check my assignments for plagiarism before submitting them?
Yes, you can screen your assignments through Turnitin as many times as you wish before the due date and view the Originality Report to ensure proper referencing.
In what format should I submit my written documents?
All written documents must be in PDF, .docx (Word), or .pptx (PowerPoint) format.
Can I get an extension if I have technology-related issues?
Technology-related issues are not grounds for an extension. Ensure you back up your work and plan for potential technology challenges.
How are grades allocated for group work?
Work submitted by a team will receive the same grade, but the grade will be weighted more for the component leader. Ensure your submission is cohesive and free of plagiarism.
What should I do if I miss a midterm exam?

Missing a midterm will result in a grade of zero unless you have a legitimate reason such as illness or emergency. There will be a deferred cumulative exam at the end of the term for those with valid excuses.
What are the rules for exams in this course?
Exams will be conducted online using Respondus Lockdown Browser. They are closed book, and no electronic devices or cheat sheets are permitted.
Can the course elements be modified during the term?
Yes, the instructor and university reserve the right to modify course elements. Any changes will be announced via CourseLink and email.
What should I do if I need accommodation for a disability?
Contact the Centre for Students with Disabilities as soon as possible to arrange necessary accommodations.
What counts as academic misconduct?
Academic misconduct includes plagiarism, unauthorized collaboration, and using unauthorized aids. Ensure your work is original and properly-referenced.
